__e: Uh, two weeks ago, I get a call to the house-- the neighbor heard some screaming.
I don't think so, love, unless the neighbours have rung 'em.
There's also a slightly confusing report of an evening that you and Mrs. Hardwicke spent together during which a fire brigade was summoned.
She had a dental appointment, only I know she didn't turn up because I rang up to see if she'd been.
Exactly. I can't tell you how many times Tommy and I been called out to a missing kid, he's hiding in the house somewhere.
--do you hear? Because something sure ain't right.
I invited them down. I said, "Come out and check out this kid". They went, "All right".
This is where we accomplish that, gentlemen.
I care about one thing and one thing only. That is the future victims that you will be asked to save.
It's not nice to be called that
They don't like to be called that.
The beat is on the lookout- and we may get called in soon, but I want you at this briefing.
Are you telling me... that you called us out here for a dead dog?
I've called you here, on this endless night, because we have a murderer in our midst.
I think we had a great life in the city, but I believe the Lord has called us here.
